body_content.explanation: to arrange something or a collection of things again in a new place or way so that it can be seen by the public:
examples: Redisplaying the exhibits in a flexible, accessible way will embody our commitment to being a modern city.
Most of the collection would be re-displayed in another building on the site.

body_content.explanation: to show words, pictures, etc. again for a second, third, etc. time on a screen:
examples: If you have lost the task bar, just press Ctrl-Esc to redisplay it.
Click here to re-display the list of houses to allow you to select another house.

body_content.explanation: the act of arranging something or a collection of things again in a new place or way so that it can be seen by the public:
examples: A redisplay has been forced on English Heritage by the buildingconstruction work.
The committee have been consulted over the redisplay of the existing porcelain collection.

body_content.explanation: the fact of words, pictures, etc. being shown electronically again, for a second, third, etc. time, for example on a computer screen:
examples: Instantaneous images can also be saved for redisplay or for printout.
It is forbidden to copy any of the recipes for redisplay on other web sites.
